info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 3:19PM MDT until July 30 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Cerro Pelado burn scar in... East Central Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... * Until 715 PM MDT. * At 319 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the eastern Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Up to 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Alamo Canyon, Canada Camada, Peralta Canyon, Bland Canyon, Rio Chiquito, Tent Rocks National Monument, Cochiti Pueblo, and Cochiti Golf Club. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cochiti Pueblo and Pena Blanca. The heaviest rain fell from the headwaters of Alamo Canyon to the headwaters of the Rio Chiquito, including the canyons of the San Miguel Mountains. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
